title: "Exploring the Perception of Human Consciousness through Extraordinary Experiences"
first_phrase: In the preceding text, the author discusses the challenges and dangers of exploring a new, wondrous world. They recommend embracing and even intensifying vertigo sensations in order to overcome the ultimate trial: crossing the threshold of death and returning to life with heightened perception. In this final portion, the author delves into the strange phenomena perceptible during these experiments, including the abandonment of physical form and the acquisition of a new mode of being. The text concludes with insights on achieving perfect lucidity in the face of death.
content: Quien logra superar este punto, cruzando el umbral de la muerte podrá después de una serie ininterrumpida de pruebas, habituarse a los vértigos mismos y no padecerlos, sino logra superar a este punto, de hecho no se da cuenta de lo que ha hecho, y por lo tanto provoca una perfecta lucidez la brecha entre dos modos de ser, abandonando el cuerpo físico en estado de muerte aparente para vivir otra vida, y readquiriendo después conscientemente el modo primitivo. Extrañísimos son los fenómenos que se presentan en la percepción en el curso de tales experimentos.
last_phrase: In conclusion, crossing the threshold of death is not only about facing vertigo and fear, but also about attaining a new level of awareness and perception. Through a series of uninterrupted trials, one can acquire the ability to habituate to the vertigo and embrace the gap between two modes of existence. And in doing so, the perception of the world can be heightened and controlled, leading to a deeper understanding of self and life.
